title: WeWork to axe 2,000 jobs this week as new bosses battle to save it from collapse
text:
WeWork is set to lay off 2,000 employees around the world as it battles to avoid running out of money.

The office space rental company is preparing to announce global layoffs as soon as this week which are likely to affect employees in the UK, The Guardian reports.

WeWork’s move to reduce its staff costs comes as the firm’s two new chief executives are likely to embark on a wider cost-cutting exercise that may slow down the pace at which it opens new office locations.

Experts said last week that the business could close locations which didn’t make financial sense for the business to continue to run.

Mat Oakley, head of Savills’ UK and European commercial property research team, said cuts are...
description: WeWork is set to lay off 2,000 employees around the world as it battles to avoid running out of money.
